articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Khanh Vu
articles.description: Vietnam plans to restart its biggest rare-earths mine next year with a Western-backed project that could rival the world's largest, according to two companies involved, as part of a broader push to dent China's dominance in a sector that helps power advanced technologies.
articles.title: Inside Vietnam's plans to dent China's rare earths dominance

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ford Motor (F.N) said late on Sunday that it still has "significant gaps to close" on key economic issues to reach a new labor agreement with the United Auto Workers union.
articles.title: Ford says 'significant gaps' remain to reach UAW contract deal

articles.author: Florence Tan
articles.description: Oil prices rose on Monday as investors focused on a tighter supply outlook after Moscow issued a temporary ban on fuel exports while remaining wary of further rate hikes that could dampen demand.
articles.title: Oil climbs with tight supply back in focus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union has no intention of cutting ties with China even as the bloc takes steps to lower economic dependencies and de-risk, but China "could do a lot" to help reduce the perception of risk, the EU trade chief said on Monday.
articles.title: China could do 'a lot' to reduce EU perception of risk -EU trade chief

articles.author: Divya Chowdhury, Savio Shetty
articles.description: Indian bond markets won't see a jump in volatility in the near-term after JPMorgan (JPM.N) announced India's inclusion in its widely tracked emerging market debt index, BlackRock's head of Asia Pacific fixed income said on Friday.
articles.title: No volatility jump in Indian bonds after JPMorgan inclusion, says BlackRock

articles.author: Byron Kaye, Himanshi Akhand
articles.description: Australia's biggest airline Qantas Airways (QAN.AX) said on Monday it will spend more than previously planned to improve "customer pain points" but warned spiralling fuel costs may force it to raise fares from already-elevated levels.
articles.title: Qantas warns rising fuel costs may hit fares

articles.author: Christian Kraemer
articles.description: The German government will put on indefinite hold plans to require more stringent building insulation standards, environment minister Robert Habeck told Reuters, an effort to help prop up the ailing building industry.
articles.title: Exclusive: Germany scraps plans for more stringent building standards to prop up industry

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski, Lisa Richwine
articles.description: Hollywood's writers union said it reached a preliminary labor agreement with major studios on Sunday, a deal expected to end one of two strikes that have halted most film and television production and cost the California economy billions.
articles.title: Striking Hollywood writers reach tentative deal with studios

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci
articles.description: Gunmen in armoured vehicles stormed a village in an ethnic Serbian-majority region of Kosovo on Sunday, battling police and barricading themselves in a monastery in a resurgence of violence in the restive north.
articles.title: Gunmen battle police in Kosovo monastery siege; four dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italian Mafia boss Matteo Messina Denaro, who was arrested in January after spending 30 years on the run, has died, AFP reported on Monday, citing Italian media.
articles.title: Jailed Italian Mafia boss Messina Denaro dies -media reports
